title: Rust v1.61+ produces larger code on Risc-V

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

labels.name: I-heavy
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to binary size of generated code.

labels.name: E-needs-bisection
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs bisection: https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo-bisect-rustc

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a regression report! 🐛 A regression is something that changed between versions of Rust but was not supposed to.

Please provide a short summary of the regression, along with any information you feel is relevant to replicate it.
-->

### Code

I tried to build [this code](https://github.com/riscv-rust/longan-nano/blob/328be12f4201536717a52e2e8b3fd17dc7f1959f/examples/sdcard_test.rs) with `cargo build --features sdcard --example sdcard_test --release`

NOTE: everything is for the target `riscv32imac-unknown-none-elf`

I expected to see this happen: a valid executable to be produced

Instead, this happened: link error due to insufficient flash memory

### Version it worked on

<!--
Provide the most recent version this worked on, for example:

It most recently worked on: Rust 1.47
-->

It most recently worked on: 1.60

### Version with regression

<!--
Provide the version you are using that has the regression.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.61.0 (fe5b13d68 2022-05-18)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: fe5b13d681f25ee6474be29d748c65adcd91f69e
commit-date: 2022-05-18
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.61.0
LLVM version: 14.0.0
```

#### Additional information
Changing the flash definition to have more memory available and comparing the resulting binaries we see these differences between artefacts produced by rust 1.60 and 1.61:

```
$ size sdcard_test_1.60_memory-cb
   text    data     bss     dec     hex filename
  64928       8   32760   97696   17da0 sdcard_test_1.60_memory-cb
$ size sdcard_test_1.61_memory-cb
   text    data     bss     dec     hex filename
  66780       8   32760   99548   184dc sdcard_test_1.61_memory-cb
```

Doing objdump for the `.test` section shows roughly 1k extra lines but nothing obviously sticking out. Using `cargo bloat` produces an interesting diff that seems to indicate almost every piece of generated code got inflated in rust v1.61 compared to v1.60

![cargo_bloat_diff](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1950958/221711926-30a800bc-7413-448d-8d75-5aacb88bc87a.png)
